page.title: 12HILTON VILLAGE
page.content: Hilton is still a small village (Pop. 1655 in 1981)although in the past few years several groups of new houses have been built.Amenities include two park/play areas and two new tennis courts.The Gravel Pits and Brook provide pleasant areas for walking and nature study.There are many organisations,ranging from Scouts, Cubs,Guides,Brownies and a Drama group for the youngsters,to the Evergreens for the Senior Citizens.The village also has a W.I.,P.T.A.,Gardening club, Cricket and Football clubs and a thriving Village Hall,used for both Public and Private functions.The main A516 Stoke to Derby road cuts through the village,but although talk of a by- pass has been going on for many years, there is little firm information available at present.
